alert.note: Alert for Bureau; La Salle; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 20 at 7:15PM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at La Salle affecting La Salle, Putnam and Bureau Counties. For the Illinois River (Upper)...including Ottawa, La Salle... elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by a combination of elevated river levels and river ice continues. * WHERE...Illinois River from Starved Rock Lock and Dam downstream to confluence with Big Bureau Creek, including the La Salle gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...Flooding of low-lying agricultural areas near La Salle and Peru is likely. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Saturday the stage was 18.1 feet. - Forecast...River levels are expected to remain near bankfull for the next several days while heavy river ice remains in place. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: An ice jam is affecting water levels in this area. River forecasts during ice jams are less certain due to many complicated factors. Significant river ice cover can cause large water level fluctuations and flooding with little advanced notice. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Sunday afternoon at 115 PM CST.
